thread.title: Big Brother legend Pete Bennett working as a CLEANER after losing his £100,000 prize money
thread.title_full: Big Brother legend Pete Bennett working as a CLEANER after losing his £100,000 prize money

author: Joshua Haigh
title: Big Brother legend Pete Bennett working as a CLEANER after losing his £100,000 prize money
text:
Showbiz Big Brother legend Pete Bennett working as a CLEANER after losing his £100,000 prize money The reality star has turned his life around after he appeared on Jeremy Kyle back in 2015 and admitted he was homeless Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Big Brother winner Pete Bennett cleans houses for a living Share this video     
Big Brother star Pete Bennett has gone down an entirely new career path. 
The winner, who enjoyed a romance with fellow legend Nikki Graham, has launched new cleaning service Celebriclean. 
Despite winning £100,000 when he became the last to leave the house in 2006, the 34-year-old will now clean your house for £100 an hour. 
He wrote on the company’s Facebook page: “I am proud to announce that Ive started my new cleaning business… Pete's new career (Photo: petebennettuk/Instagram) He's cleaning houses now (Photo: petebennettuk/Instagram) 
“so If you need your place spotless, gizza call , I’m your man! Selfies and FUN included” 
Pete told The Daily Star: "I don't mind getting my hands dirty and I'll do any sort of cleaning job. 
"I think other celebrities will definitely come on board because t here are a lot who need money between the work. It'll be a good laugh. 
"It's definitely a novel way of getting a cleaner in but it's not a gimmick, I will definitely clean their homes, I'm pretty good at it." He won Big Brother in 2006 (Photo: www.celebriclean.com) 
It's been a long road to recovery for Pete. 
He appeared on Jeremy Kyle in 2015 and admitted that he had been made homeless after becoming hooked on drugs. Like us on Facebook
